programme.title: Long Lost Family: What Happened Next
programme.desc: Davina and Nicky revisit Maureen who discovered a brother and sister that she previously knew nothing about. Plus Fiona, whose reunion with her sister brought the revelation that her biological mother was still alive. (Final)

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Jerry Coleby-Williams visits a bushland botanic gardens, Millie Ross looks at climbing plants, Tino Carnevale shares tool tips, Josh Byrne explores an inspiring revegetation project and we meet a passionate frog expert.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across today. Presented by Kathryn Robinson.

programme.title: The Forsytes
programme.desc: Jolyon recommits to his family and June and Phil get engaged. Soames and Irenes Parisian honeymoon is cut short when Soames feels out of his depth.

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Rita and James have just 230 thousand dollars to self-build a sustainable, off-grid family home for themselves and their two kids. They plan to use recycled plastic bags, milk cartons, home-made bricks, and an earthen floor.

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: Tragedy strikes in Saint-Fiacre, while back in Paris Maigrets absence has terrifying consequences. (Final)

programme.title: Spicks And Specks
programme.desc: Colin Lane gets on a roll, Danielle Walker shares her ride-on mower tips, Devaura needs her support teddy, and Kram is well... Kram. Somewhere amongst this, a quiz show happens ending with a performance by Grace Cummings.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: The Lyell team unveil corruption and deceit within the local jurisdiction of Southbay. (Final)

programme.title: Rage Charts
programme.desc: Count down the hottest chart hits and catch up on some of the most promising new popular music videos on rage.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Keep the party vibe going every Saturday morning with wall-to-wall music videos, from classic hits and long-forgotten tracks from the rage vault, to the latest new releases and special features.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: Melissa Mackay presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: Tragedy strikes in Saint-Fiacre, while back in Paris Maigrets absence has terrifying consequences. (Final)

programme.title: ABC News
programme.desc: News from where we live. ABC News NSW brings you the days top stories, exclusive investigations and original reporting on the issues that matter to you. Presented by Lydia Feng, plus sport with Chloe Hart.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: DCI Vera Stanhope is called to a quiet country lane where a young man has been found dead following a collision with a car. On closer inspection, it becomes clear that this is not an accident and is way more than a hit and run.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Pikmin 4, Viewfinder and Geometry Wars Face-off!
programme.desc: This week on GGSP: Gem digs into some adorable backyard action in her review of Pikmin 4, plus we do a speed-run review of Viewfinder, and Harry and Gem face-off in a Geometry Wars challenge!

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Incredible Fortune Teller
programme.desc: Ezra and Avas friendship is tested when Ramonas fortune telling predictions come between them during the Coins for a Cure fundraiser.

programme.title: Malory Towers
programme.desc: Felicity is keen to drop the mini-Rivers nickname and become her own Malory success, but when she befriends a feisty new second-former, Josephine Jones, it isnt long before they start getting into trouble!

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Shaggy takes the Gang to the Minor League Baseball stadium of his youth only to learn that its about to be shut down because a Ghostly Baseball Player is scaring away the fans - and the team!

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: The Powerpuff Girls have to find a way to save Donny the Unicorn before its too late!

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Flock and the Pigs are playing a high-spirited game of rounders. Shaun steps up to the plate - will he score the winning run? Will the Pigs foul-play prevent victory? Or will the Farmer discover what theyre up to?

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Kai faces off against his former friend.

programme.title: Officially Amazing
programme.desc: Tyre juggling, hoop jumping, sandwich-making with the toes, and the highest bungee jump into water are just some of the records attempted today.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Disney Illusion Island And Celeste Challenge!
programme.desc: This week on GGSP, we review the animated platforming action of Disney Illusion Island, plus Harry and Gem tackle a Celeste Co-Op Challenge, and we share some games that are like Super Smash Bros. but different!

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Keep the party vibe going with wall-to-wall music videos, from new releases to classics and the long-forgotten.

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Sleepover Secret
programme.desc: Pixie is furious when something she privately told Ava is made public, so Maudie resolves to find out how Pixies secret got out.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo And Guess Who?
programme.sub-title: The Scooby Of A Thousand Faces!
programme.desc: The gang teams up with Wonder Woman in Greece.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: The Amoeba Boys wreak havoc on the Internet.

programme.title: ABC Kids Programs Resume At 4am
programme.desc: ABC Kids programs resume at 4.00am

programme.title: The Night Before Christmas In Wonderland
programme.desc: St Nick receives a delayed letter on Christmas Eve from the Princess of Hearts. He and his dedicated team of reindeer set off to Wonderland to deliver her gift.

programme.title: Dragon Ball Super
programme.sub-title: The Matches Begin! Were All Off To The "planet With No Name"!
programme.desc: Its time to head to the tournament! Everyone gathers, and the mysterious fighter Monaka is finally revealed. Once on the "Planet With No Name," they size up their competition which includes...another Saiyan?!

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Moving Out 2 And Noob Cops Part 1
programme.desc: This week on GGSP, we review the multiplayer furniture moving mayhem of Moving Out 2, plus the Noob Cops begin their investigation into a mysterious series of Noob Crimes!

programme.title: Rage Charts
programme.desc: Count down the hottest chart hits and catch up on some of the most promising new popular music videos on rage.

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous: The Collection
programme.desc: Saffy, Edinas daughter and Patsys nemesis, is next for the star treatment. Rivals for Edinas attention, she and Patsy never get on, unless theres an ulterior motive.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: The Titans trick Starfire into believing in second Christmas.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: Santa Claus forces Beast Boy to become a spy and report on the Titans naughty behavior.

programme.title: Moominvalley
programme.desc: Snork Maiden encourages Moomintroll to take her on a voyage where Moominpappa once encountered the storm-chasing Hattifatteners.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: The agents try to resolve a disagreement between Ms O and Oksana.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: Fed up with sharing, Panda forbids his brothers from using his cellphone any longer. But when the brothers get their own super advanced smartphones, Panda starts to succumb to crippling jealousy.

programme.title: My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic
programme.desc: Spike accidentally invites Ember and Thorax to Ponyville on the same day! Hes sure the two new leaders are not going to get along so he does all he can to keep them apart and cover the fact that the other is there.

programme.title: Steven Universe
programme.desc: Steven joins an underground wrestling league with Amethyst, who is tired of Pearl and Garnet bringing her down.

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: Adam and Jamie investigate; can Christmas lights cause a Christmas tree fire? Meanwhile, Kari, Grant and Tori investigate a frontier technology that if confirmed would take-off in a big way.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Purple-loving Pauline Ridley has been struggling to sell her terrace for six months. Phil soon discovers, this isnt just about Paulines penchant for deep purples and pinks, theres an asbestos scare in the mix too.

programme.title: Fracture
programme.desc: In this taut courtroom thriller, a young assistant district attorney gets involved in a deadly cat-and-mouse game with a man who tried to murder his wife. The young prosecutor refuses to give up.

programme.title: rage Vault Guest Programmer: No Doubt
programme.desc: Filmed during No Doubts 2000 Return Of Saturn Tour, join Gwen, Tom, Tony and Kamal as they guest program rage.

programme.title: Ghosts
programme.desc: Mikes anxiety about the future grows. Thomas spots Lady Buttons talents.

programme.title: Heartbreak High
programme.desc: Nikki uncovers the source of Kurts passion for the environment.

programme.title: Moominvalley
programme.desc: Incensed by the rule-loving Park Keeper, Snufkin plots a cunning revenge. But when his friends get the blame for his actions, Snufkin must come to their rescue.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Its bath time for a reluctant Timmy. In trying to escape, Timmy gets a spring attached to his tail. Its up to the flock to catch the bouncing baby sheep and return him to the tub before he destroys the farm.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania: The Series
programme.desc: Uncle Genes been invited to a performance of the Northern Frights. He doesnt want to go so Mavis tricks him into attending without realising shes leading him to his doom!

programme.title: Lagging
programme.desc: Its Sols turn to take his grandma Naomis mail to her new retirement home - which he hates as shes so critical and likes to check the inside of his ears for dirt.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil and Aud Briars have been trying to sell their home in Melton Mowbray for six months. Theres an interesting colour scheme in this home but with some hard graft, Phil is convinced he can get them the deal they deserve.

programme.title: Live At The Apollo
programme.desc: A special festive edition hosted by the fabulous Tom Allen, who introduces Thanyia Moore and Lloyd Griffith to the stage.

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous
programme.desc: Eddy and Patsy splash out on a weekend of country pursuits. They go fully equipped with a selection of Ralph Lauren 1930s country fashion.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Kai and friends defend the forest creatures homes.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: King Thistle does not want to get any older so decides that no one must celebrate his birthday. But all of the Little Kingdom has been waiting to celebrate the Kings birthday with a brilliant party.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The Twirlywoos watch people using a lift in a building. Chickedy and Chick follow two people into the lift and go up high with them, waving to Great BigHoo and Toodloo.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: Prince Wednesday and Jodi learn how to take care of Prince Wednesdays new pet guinea pig when she needs to rest.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Grandpa Pig brings some seeds for Peppa and George to grow a garden. Daddy Pig makes himself useful by being the scarecrow.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Paddington discovers Mr Brown is a fantastic dancer so enters him into the Town Hall Talent Contest. However, Mr Brown gets stage fright. Paddington to the rescue!

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Mr Elf is overworked so King Thistle sentences him to a holiday. He isnt too pleased. Mrs Elf and Ben however are overjoyed at the news. Meanwhile Nanny takes over the food deliveries.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are at a Jigsaw festival with Granny and Grandpa Pig. Old Mrs Donkey explains how important it is not to lose a jigsaw piece but then Peppa spots one on the floor! Thankfully, Peppa finds its home.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Its the hottest day of summer and while Gemma leads a dolphin rescue, Pounce is determined to prove kangaroos can beat the heat.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Searching for a vital part of the ship lost during their crash landing, Cosima and Big Lizard find Dunk stuck on a beach. They use science to save the day and make a new friend.

programme.title: Play School: Whats Cooking?
programme.desc: You cant forget about dessert! Abi and Rachael are looking for a dreamy dessert to end the day. With help from dessert star Morgan Hipworth, they create a feast of watermelon pizza and banana and cauliflower ice cream

programme.title: Mixmups
programme.desc: When Spins pet ant dies, he takes to his duvet cave of sadness. Will Pockets and Giggle find "another way" to help Spin with his sadness?

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing wants to play his car park game with Flop but Charlie is visiting and keeps messing up the game. Bing doesnt enjoy his game on his own and finds out that some games are better played together.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey and Bingo love to videochat with Muffin and Socks so they can all draw pictures together. When Muffin wont give Socks a turn, the kids discover what happens when you hog.

programme.title: Mister Maker Around The World
programme.desc: In Hong Kong Mini Makers help Mister Maker create a Chinese dragon picture. In South Africa, we discover whether he can make a super Silly Straw and in the UK, we go down to a farm and make a fabulous finger tip work of art.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: All Engines Go
programme.desc: Thomas and Nia play with spare lights, excited to stay up all night to test them. James thinks that goofing is a waste of time and he is much to busy to stop his work for his own scheduled headlight repair.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Granny Pig, Peppa and George have fun dressing up as Romans, making a pebble mosaic of a Dinosaur and learn a little Latin too!

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: When Ginger gets stung by an Appleflyus it leaves a painful and incredibly itchy sore but, the only way to cure it is with the tail of an Appleflyus!

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: When Fergie is feeling off, Vida diagnoses her - shes having a sad day.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Kelp Forest Rescue
programme.desc: When Pesos little brother Pinto comes to visit, hes more interested in being a pirate than a medic - at least until he accompanies Peso on a mission to rescue Dashi and Shellington in a kelp forest.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: When Night Ninja needs the PJs help, our heroes cant help taking advantage of it.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: On a wildlife sketching trip, Norman wants to find the most spectacular creature to sketch, but this gets a bit tricky when Lily Chen tags along.

programme.title: Play School: My Place My Home
programme.desc: Teo is in Swan Valley with Little Ted, making friends with kangaroos and wombats! Miah and Nicholas go camping and whip up some delicious Johnny Cakes, and the toys work together to fix the Town Hall for its reopening

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are birdwatching with Grandpa Pig looking for birds and ticking them off in Grandpa pigs book.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: When the buggy gets a flat tyre Dad, Cosima and Big Lizard are stranded. Big Lizards playful nature helps reveal a creative solution to their problem.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: The cadets train Bondi and Sandy for their annual Iron Roo carnival - but how far are they willing to go to win?

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: When the Ninjalinos suddenly lose their ninja powers, the PJ Masks try to teach them alternative skills. But it seems impossible to get the Ninjalinos interested... Or is it?

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Its a day out; Duggee and the squirrels are off on an underwater adventure with Bettys dad in his submarine. They see all the wonders of the underwater world, including a giant sea stallion and some jazz fish.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Carrot has created the ultimate Superhero vehicle - The Tato Car. But, Evil Pea steals the car, not realising the Grape Kids are in the back seat!

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: Kai and Master Zia must get back her stolen ship.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Holly breaks her wand and must go to the Wand Factory, at the bottom of the Great Elf Tree, to get it fixed.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.sub-title: More About This Way, That Way
programme.desc: The Twirlywoos find themselves in a restaurant, and The Box pays the Twirlywoos a visit.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.sub-title: Daniel Doesnt Want to Miss Out
programme.desc: Daniel has to go potty, but is worried there wont be space for his sea turtle on the class mural when hes done in the bathroom

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Doctor Hamster is having a busy day - there are lots of helpless animals that need her help!

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.sub-title: Paddington Digs A Tunnel To Peru
programme.desc: Paddington decides to dig a tunnel through the centre of the earth to Peru but ends up in Mr Currys green house.

programme.title: Isadora Moon
programme.desc: Isadoras friend Zoe persuades Isadora to swap abilities - so she can try out magical powers and Isadora can try a day without fairy magic or vampire skills.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Dad refuses to be late dropping off Bluey and Bingo at kindy and school, but the girls make Dad play so many games, they quickly derail his plan.

programme.title: Knee High Spies
programme.desc: Silver Paw tries to make a sleepover party go to sleep so she can steal their late-night pizza snack. With Jeremy tucked tightly into bed, Deena must learn to crack the puzzles all by herself.

programme.title: Fizzy And Suds
programme.desc: Fizzy and Suds explore diggers! They watch a giant bucket scoop rocks, learn how tracks help move on rough ground, and see these powerful machines saw, sift, and crush at construction sites.

programme.title: Stick Man
programme.desc: Stick Man lives in the family tree with his Stick Lady Love and their stick children three but its dangerous being a Stick Man as a dog wants to play with him. Join Stick Man on his troublesome journey back to the family tree.

programme.title: Andy And The Band
programme.desc: Professor Quantum needs help inventing a machine that creates instant Rockstar talent.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are birdwatching with Grandpa Pig looking for birds and ticking them off in Grandpa pigs book.

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: During a hoverboard race Dads new super-powered hoverboard malfunctions, so Cosima and Big Lizard throw the race to rescue him!

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: Zigzag needs to wear an eye patch. Vida enlists Molasses seeing eye snail, but Zigzag refuses.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Albino Humpback Whale
programme.desc: The Octonauts help out an albino humpback whale with nasty sunburn.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Pharaoh Boy absorbs the PJs powers into his boomerangs.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When James and Sarah compete for the title of best steam driver, James accidentally spills a burning coal into a pile of wood, sparking a fire.

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: Snowed in and unable to go shopping, Millie and her Mom decide to bake their annual Christmas cake instead.

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: When Millie cant reach her badminton racquets because of a spider web, she and her friends realize they can make their own special racquets.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Tammy and the junior gardeners create the ultimate dinosaur backyard garden paradise, rawwwr!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Madame Gazelle teaches the children how to play Bat and Ball, she teaches them so well that they beat her at the game and win!

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.sub-title: The Tale Of The Treehouse Rescue
programme.desc: When Peter is forced to reveal the location of the secret treehouse to Flopsy and Mopsy, the girls decide to hang out in Peters den - just as Old Brown launches a tree-top attack!

programme.title: Octonauts: Above And Beyond
programme.desc: Stranded in an Australian swamp, Peso and Dashi help a flying fox mother and her pup survive the sweltering heat.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Dad has rudely plonked himself on one end of the seesaw. So Bluey and Bingo round up the entire playground to help flip him off, but they still need to find one more friend.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee has made a delicious apple pie. He puts it on the windowsill to cool down - but the second his back is turned its gone. Who took it? Fortunately, Duggee has his Detective Badge and follows some small footprints.

programme.title: Piripenguins
programme.desc: When the Emperor Penguin visits the berg, he discovers Pancake is a long-lost Prince.

programme.desc: Davina and Nicky revisit Maureen who discovered a brother and sister that she previously knew nothing about. Plus Fiona, whose reunion with her sister brought the revelation that her biological mother was still alive. (Final)

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Know the latest on the days top stories, as Michael Tetlow brings you a comprehensive roundup of the news of the day. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the latest on todays news, covering whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe to bring you the news you need to know. Presented by Michael Tetlow in Perth.

programme.title: Heywire
programme.desc: Discover the voices of young Australians as they share powerful, lived experiences from life in regional communities. Stories from the 2025 Heywire project that celebrate resilience, creativity and the spirit of the regions.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Girish Sawlani presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: News Breakfast
programme.desc: As the day begins get the facts you need to stay informed. James Glenday and Emma Rebellato bring you the latest news, overnight developments and todays top stories, plus Charles Brice with sport and Nate Byrne with weather.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Lorna Dunkley brings you todays top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter most.

programme.title: ABC News Afternoons
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News through the day. We have reporters in more places, to tell you whats happening and why it matters. Lorna Dunkley brings you the latest news and information.

programme.title: ABC News With Joe OBrien
programme.desc: Melissa Mackay brings you a comprehensive summary of the days events, with the latest breaking news, in depth coverage of the top stories, live crosses, interviews and explainers to bring you up to speed on whats going on.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news, with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Melissa Mackay.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: The latest breaking news and a comprehensive roundup of todays best stories from across Australias states and regions. With reporters in more places ABC News tells the stories that matter to you. Presented by Manny Tsigas.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Manny Tsigas presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: The home of breaking news and in-depth coverage of the big stories from across Australia and around the globe. The ABCs network of reporters cover important stories and all the news you need. Presented by Manny Tsigas.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News. Weve got more reporters in more places, connecting communities and covering the stories and issues that matter to you. Presented by Craig Smart.

programme.title: The Breakfast Couch
programme.desc: Bridget Brennan, James Glenday, Emma Rebellato and the team hear from some of the guests who appeared on News Breakfast. Plus regulars including film critic Zak Hepburn and resident foodie Alice Zaslavsky. (Final for 2025)

programme.title: The Cloud Under The Sea
programme.desc: Lurking under the sea is a global web of fibre optic telecommunication cables, the plumbing of the internet. Its how we talk, text and stream, connecting billions of people. These cables are also the frontline of a tech war.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: The World
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Manny Tsigas presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.

programme.title: Boyer Lecture Series
programme.desc: Julia Baird is joined in conversation with all five 2025 Boyer lecturers, Justin Wolfers, John Anderson, Larissa Behrendt, Amelia Lester and James Curran to reflect on the theme Australia: A Radical Experiment in Democracy.

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: Start your morning with the latest headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories and the overnight news from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: The Breakfast Couch
programme.desc: Bridget Brennan, James Glenday, Emma Rebellato and the team hear from some of the guests who appeared on News Breakfast. Plus regulars including film critic Zak Hepburn and resident foodie Alice Zaslavsky. (Final for 2025)

programme.title: Jim Maxwells Ashes Memories
programme.sub-title: 2006 - Shane Warne bowls Australia to series victory at the Adelaide Oval
programme.desc: The history of the Ashes is littered with moments that have defined and intensified the rivalry between the two nations. ABC Cricket Commentator Jim Maxwell joins Corbin Middlemas to reflect on his Top 6 Ashes Moments.
